issue.title: [Bug]: Missing package results in error
issue.body:
### Already reported ? *

- [x] I have searched the existing open and closed issues.

### Regression?

Yes

### System Info and Version

<details> <summary>System/Version info</summary>

```
System:
  Host: archlinux Kernel: 6.15.8-arch1-2 arch: x86_64 bits: 64
  Desktop: Hyprland v: 0.50.1 Distro: Arch Linux
Machine:
  Type: Desktop System: Gigabyte product: B450M H v: -CF
    serial: <superuser required>
  Mobo: Gigabyte model: B450M H v: x.x serial: <superuser required>
    UEFI: American Megatrends LLC. v: F63 date: 08/03/2022
CPU:
  Info: 6-core model: AMD Ryzen 5 5600G with Radeon Graphics bits: 64
    type: MT MCP cache: L2: 3 MiB
  Speed (MHz): avg: 2368 min/max: 404/4466 cores: 1: 2368 2: 2368 3: 2368
    4: 2368 5: 2368 6: 2368 7: 2368 8: 2368 9: 2368 10: 2368 11: 2368 12: 2368
Graphics:
  Device-1: Advanced Micro Devices [AMD/ATI] Cezanne [Radeon Vega Series /
    Radeon Mobile Series] driver: amdgpu v: kernel
  Display: wayland server: X.org v: 1.21.1.18 with: Xwayland v: 24.1.8
    compositor: Hyprland v: 0.50.1 driver: X: loaded: amdgpu
    unloaded: modesetting dri: radeonsi gpu: amdgpu resolution: 1366x768~60Hz
  API: EGL Message: EGL data requires eglinfo. Check --recommends.
  Info: Tools: wl: nwg-displays x11: xprop,xrandr
Audio:
  Device-1: Advanced Micro Devices [AMD/ATI] Renoir Radeon High Definition
    Audio driver: snd_hda_intel
  Device-2: Advanced Micro Devices [AMD] Family 17h/19h/1ah HD Audio
    driver: snd_hda_intel
  Device-3: Barco Display Systems USBSH1
    driver: hid-generic,snd-usb-audio,usbhid type: USB
  API: ALSA v: k6.15.8-arch1-2 status: kernel-api
  Server-1: PipeWire v: 1.4.7 status: active
Network:
  Device-1: Realtek RTL8111/8168/8211/8411 PCI Express Gigabit Ethernet
    driver: r8169
  IF: enp8s0 state: up speed: 100 Mbps duplex: full mac: d8:5e:d3:fd:da:6d
Drives:
  Local Storage: total: 447.15 GiB used: 157.79 GiB (35.3%)
  ID-1: /dev/sda vendor: Kingston model: SA400S37240G size: 223.57 GiB
  ID-2: /dev/sdb vendor: SanDisk model: SSD PLUS 240GB size: 223.58 GiB
Partition:
  ID-1: / size: 222.57 GiB used: 79.17 GiB (35.6%) fs: btrfs dev: /dev/sda2
  ID-2: /boot size: 1022 MiB used: 172.9 MiB (16.9%) fs: vfat dev: /dev/sda1
  ID-3: /home size: 222.57 GiB used: 79.17 GiB (35.6%) fs: btrfs
    dev: /dev/sda2
  ID-4: /var/log size: 222.57 GiB used: 79.17 GiB (35.6%) fs: btrfs
    dev: /dev/sda2
Swap:
  ID-1: swap-1 type: zram size: 4 GiB used: 0 KiB (0.0%) dev: /dev/zram0
Sensors:
  System Temperatures: cpu: 46.8 C mobo: 33.0 C gpu: amdgpu temp: 40.0 C
  Fan Speeds (rpm): N/A
Info:
  Memory: total: 16 GiB note: est. available: 14.5 GiB used: 3.32 GiB (22.9%)
  Processes: 331 Uptime: 13m Shell: Zsh inxi: 3.3.38
```

</details>

### KooL's Dots version

v2.3.16

### Description

Package **jq** is not included in the update so when the **WallpaperSelect.sh** script tries to get the focused monitor and cant detect it

```
focused_monitor=$(hyprctl monitors -j | jq -r '.[] | select(.focused) | .name')

# Ensure focused_monitor is detected
if [[ -z "$focused_monitor" ]]; then
  notify-send -i "$iDIR/error.png" "E-R-R-O-R" "Could not detect focused monitor"
  exit 1
fi
```



### How to reproduce

Just use the WalpaperSelect script without the jq package installed


### install logs, images or videos

_No response_

issue.title: [Bug]: Config Error with new update some properties of render doesnt exist
issue.body:
### Already reported ? * - [x] I have searched the existing open and closed issues. ### Regression? Yes ### System Info and Version

Check --recommends. Info: Tools: wl: nwg-displays x11: xprop,xrandr Audio: Device-1: Advanced Micro Devices [AMD/ATI] Renoir Radeon High Definition Audio driver: snd_hda_intel Device-2: Advanced Micro Devices [AMD] Family 17h/19h/1ah HD Audio driver: snd_hda_intel Device-3: Barco Display Systems USBSH1 driver: hid-generic,snd-usb-audio,usbhid type: USB API: ALSA v: k6.15.6-arch1-1 status: kernel-api Server-1: PipeWire v: 1.4.6 status: active Network: Device-1: Realtek RTL8111/8168/8211/8411 PCI Express Gigabit Ethernet driver: r8169 IF: enp8s0 state: up speed: 100 Mbps duplex: full mac: d8:5e:d3:fd:da:6d IF-ID-1: br-2b1c4acec0e5 state: down mac: 12:c1:ea:93:8a:8d IF-ID-2: docker0 state: down mac: 4a:2c:70:f3:18:56 Drives: Local Storage: total: 447.15 GiB used: 341.62 GiB (76.4%) ID-1: /dev/sda vendor: Kingston model: SA400S37240G size: 223.57 GiB ID-2: /dev/sdb vendor: SanDisk model: SSD PLUS 240GB size: 223.58 GiB Partition: ID-1: / size: 222.57 GiB used: 147.6 GiB (66.3%) fs: btrfs dev: /dev/sda2 ID-2: /boot size: 1022 MiB used: 172.7 MiB (16.9%) fs: vfat dev: /dev/sda1 ID-3: /home size: 222.57 GiB used: 147.6 GiB (66.3%) fs: btrfs dev: /dev/sda2 ID-4: /var/log size: 222.57 GiB used: 147.6 GiB (66.3%) fs: btrfs dev: /dev/sda2 Swap: ID-1: swap-1 type: zram size: 4 GiB used: 0 KiB (0.0%) dev: /dev/zram0 Sensors: System Temperatures: cpu: 45.0 C mobo: 34.0 C gpu: amdgpu temp: 42.0 C Fan Speeds (rpm): N/A Info: Memory: total: 16 GiB note: est. available: 14.5 GiB used: 1.95 GiB (13.4%) Processes: 322 Uptime: 9m Shell: Zsh inxi: 3.3.38 ```
### KooL's Dots version v2.3.15 ### Description render:explicit_sync and render:explicit_sync_kms doesn't exist at $HOME/.config/hypr/UserSettings.conf at line 107 - 108 ### How to reproduce Just appeared when hyprland updated ### install logs, images or videos
